info.title: AdminRadius Infrastructure Service API
info.description: API for managing network infrastructure including devices, ports, connections, and topologies. This service provides comprehensive endpoints for CRUD operations on network components and their relationships.

tags.name: Device
tags.description: Device management operations - Create, read, update, and delete network devices

tags.name: Device Type
tags.description: Device type management - Define and manage types of network devices (e.g., Router, Switch, Firewall)

tags.name: Device Port
tags.description: Device port management - Manage physical and logical ports on network devices

tags.name: Device Port Specification
tags.description: Port specification management - Define technical specifications for different port types

tags.name: Device Port Interface
tags.description: Port interface management - Define interface types (e.g., GigabitEthernet, 10GigabitEthernet)

tags.name: Device Connection
tags.description: Connection management - Manage connections between device ports

tags.name: Branch Topology
tags.description: Network topology operations - Retrieve complete network topology information for branches

tags.name: OpenVPN Server
tags.description: OpenVPN server management - Configure and manage OpenVPN servers with certificates and authentication

tags.name: OpenVPN Client
tags.description: OpenVPN client management - Create and manage OpenVPN client certificates for VPN connections

tags.name: Device OpenVPN Client
tags.description: Device OpenVPN client assignment - Associate devices with OpenVPN clients (only Router type devices)

tags.name: Device Radius Client
tags.description: Device RADIUS client management - Activate and deactivate RADIUS clients for devices with assigned OpenVPN clients

tags.name: Radius Client
tags.description: RADIUS client operations - Retrieve RADIUS vendors and manage RADIUS client configurations

externalDocs.description: Find more information about AdminRadius Infrastructure Service

get.summary: Get all devices in a branch
get.description: Retrieve a list of all devices within a specific branch

post.description: Create a new device in a specific branch

get.description: Retrieve detailed information about a specific device

delete.description: Remove a device from the system

get.description: Retrieve a list of all available device types

post.description: Create a new device type in the system

get.description: Retrieve detailed information about a specific device type

delete.description: Remove a device type from the system

get.summary: Get all ports of a device
get.description: Retrieve a list of all ports belonging to a specific device

post.description: Create a new port for a specific device

get.description: Retrieve detailed information about a specific device port

put.description: Update an existing device port's information

delete.description: Remove a device port from the system

get.description: Retrieve a list of all available device port specifications

post.summary: Create a new device port specification
post.description: Create a new device port specification in the system

get.summary: Get device port specification by ID
get.description: Retrieve detailed information about a specific device port specification

put.description: Update an existing device port specification

delete.description: Remove a device port specification from the system

get.description: Retrieve a list of all available device port interface types

post.summary: Create a new device port interface
post.description: Create a new device port interface type in the system

get.summary: Get device port interface by ID
get.description: Retrieve detailed information about a specific device port interface

put.description: Update an existing device port interface

delete.description: Remove a device port interface from the system

get.summary: Get all connections of a device
get.description: Retrieve a list of all port connections belonging to a specific device

post.description: Create a new connection between two device ports

get.description: Retrieve detailed information about a specific device connection

put.description: Update an existing device connection's information

delete.description: Remove a device connection from the system

get.description: Retrieve the complete network topology for a specific branch including devices, ports, and connections

200.description: Successful operation - Returns the complete network topology

get.description: Retrieve a list of all configured OpenVPN servers. Results are cached in Redis for performance.

post.description: Register a new OpenVPN server in the system. The server certificate (ca_chain_pem) and encrypted private key (encrypted_private_key_pem) are automatically generated by the CA service. Automatically refreshes the Redis cache after creation.

get.description: Retrieve detailed information about a specific OpenVPN server

put.description: Update an existing OpenVPN server configuration. Note: name, ca_chain_pem, and encrypted_private_key_pem are immutable and cannot be modified. Automatically refreshes the Redis cache after update.

delete.description: Remove an OpenVPN server from the system. Automatically refreshes the Redis cache after deletion.

get.summary: Get all OpenVPN clients for a server
get.description: Retrieve a list of all OpenVPN clients associated with a specific OpenVPN server. Results are cached in Redis for performance.

parameters.name: openvpn_server_id
parameters.description: The UUID of the OpenVPN server

post.description: Create a new OpenVPN client certificate for the specified server. The client certificate and encrypted private key are automatically generated by the CA service.

parameters.name: openvpn_server_id
parameters.description: The UUID of the OpenVPN server

get.description: Retrieve a specific OpenVPN client by its unique identifier.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The UUID of the OpenVPN client

delete.description: Delete an OpenVPN client by its unique identifier. Automatically refreshes the Redis cache after deletion.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The UUID of the OpenVPN client to delete

put.description: Associate an OpenVPN client with a device. Only devices of type 'Router' can be assigned an OpenVPN client. Each device can only have one OpenVPN client, and each OpenVPN client can only be assigned to one device.

parameters.name: device_id
parameters.description: The UUID of the device (must be of type 'Router')

parameters.name: openvpn_client_id
parameters.description: The UUID of the OpenVPN client to assign

400.description: Bad Request - Validation error or business rule violation

example: device must be of type 'Router' to assign OpenVPN client

delete.description: Remove the association between a device and an OpenVPN client.

parameters.name: openvpn_client_id
parameters.description: The UUID of the OpenVPN client to unassign

put.summary: Activate RADIUS client for a device
put.description: Activate a RADIUS client for a device that has an assigned OpenVPN client. The device must have an OpenVPN client with a reserved IP address. A new RADIUS client will be created via the RADIUS API and the secret will be encrypted and stored.

delete.summary: Deactivate RADIUS client for a device
delete.description: Deactivate and remove the RADIUS client for a device. This will delete the RADIUS client from the RADIUS API and remove the local database record.

get.description: Retrieve a list of all available RADIUS vendors. The data is cached in Redis for performance. If not in cache, it will be fetched from the external RADIUS API.

BadRequest.description: Bad Request - Invalid input parameters or validation errors

example: device_type_id must be a valid UUID

Unauthorized.description: Unauthorized - Authentication required or invalid credentials

NotFound.description: Not Found - Resource does not exist

InternalServerError.description: Internal Server Error - An unexpected error occurred

responses-BadRequest.description: Bad Request - Invalid input parameters or validation errors

example: host and port combination already exists

responses-NotFound.description: Not Found - Resource does not exist

components-responses-BadRequest.description: Bad Request - Invalid input parameters or validation errors

example: openvpn_server_id must be a valid UUID

responses-InternalServerError.description: Internal Server Error - An unexpected error occurred on the server

components-responses-NotFound.description: Not Found - The requested resource was not found

group_device_openvpn_client_components-r.description: Not Found - The requested resource was not found

components-responses-InternalServerError.description: Internal Server Error - An unexpected error occurred on the server

group_device_openvpn_client_components-r.description: Bad Request - Invalid input parameters or validation errors

example: device_id must be a valid UUID
device has no OpenVPN client assigned

name.description: Device type name (sanitized, max 255 characters, required)
Device type name (sanitized, max 255 characters, required)
Port specification name (sanitized, max 255 characters, required)

data.description: Specification data (defaults to empty object if not provided)

name.description: Port specification name (sanitized, max 255 characters, required)

data.description: Specification data (defaults to empty object if not provided)

name.description: Port interface name (sanitized, max 255 characters, required)
Port interface name (sanitized, max 255 characters, required)

from_port_id.description: Source port UUID (required, must be valid UUID)

to_port_id.description: Destination port UUID (required, must be valid UUID, must be different from from_port_id)

from_port_id.description: Source port UUID (required, must be valid UUID)

to_port_id.description: Destination port UUID (required, must be valid UUID, must be different from from_port_id)

tls_key_pem.description: TLS authentication key in PEM format
tls_key_pem.example: -----BEGIN OpenVPN Static key V1-----\n...\n-----END OpenVPN Static key V1-----

ca_chain_pem.description: CA certificate chain in PEM format (auto-generated, contains Root CA + Intermediate CA)

certificate_pem.description: Server certificate in PEM format (auto-generated, the server's own certificate)

OpenvpnServerCreateRequest.description: Request body for creating a new OpenVPN server. Certificate-related fields (ca_chain_pem, certificate_pem, encrypted_private_key_pem) are auto-generated by the CA service.

name.description: OpenVPN server name (sanitized, max 255 characters, required, must be unique)

host.description: Server hostname or IP address (sanitized, max 45 characters, required)

tls_key_pem.description: TLS authentication key in PEM format (optional)
tls_key_pem.example: -----BEGIN OpenVPN Static key V1-----\n...\n-----END OpenVPN Static key V1-----

remote_cert_tls_name.description: Remote certificate TLS name verification (default: server, max 100 characters)

crl_distribution_point.description: Certificate Revocation List distribution URL (optional, max 1000 characters)

OpenvpnServerUpdateRequest.description: Request body for updating an OpenVPN server. Note: name, ca_chain_pem, and encrypted_private_key_pem are immutable and cannot be modified.

host.description: Server hostname or IP address (sanitized, max 45 characters, required)

tls_key_pem.description: TLS authentication key in PEM format (optional)
tls_key_pem.example: -----BEGIN OpenVPN Static key V1-----\n...\n-----END OpenVPN Static key V1-----

remote_cert_tls_name.description: Remote certificate TLS name verification (required, max 100 characters)

crl_distribution_point.description: Certificate Revocation List distribution URL (optional, max 1000 characters)

components-schemas-DevicePort.description: Device port entity with complete information

schemas-DeviceConnection.description: Device connection entity with complete information

TopologyNode.description: Represents a node in the network topology structure, which could be a device with its ports and connections

ports.description: All ports belonging to this device

connections.description: All connections involving this device's ports

OpenvpnClient.description: OpenVPN client entity with certificate information

id.description: Unique identifier for the OpenVPN client

server_id.description: Reference to the OpenVPN server this client belongs to

cn.description: Common Name (CN) for the client certificate

reserved_ip_address.description: Reserved IP address assigned by the CA for this client

certificate_pem.description: The client's certificate in PEM format

revoked_at.description: Timestamp when the certificate was revoked, null if not revoked

OpenvpnClientCreateRequest.description: Request body for creating a new OpenVPN client

name.description: Optional name/CN for the client certificate. If not provided, a random CN will be generated.

DeviceOpenvpnClient.description: Association between a device and an OpenVPN client

ActivateRadiusClientRequest.description: Request body for activating a RADIUS client for a device

device_vendor_id.description: RADIUS vendor ID to associate with the client

DeviceRadiusClient.description: Device Radius Client entity representing the association between a device (via OpenVPN client) and a RADIUS client

id.description: Unique identifier for the device radius client record

radius_client_id.description: RADIUS client ID from the external RADIUS API

encrypted_secret.description: Encrypted RADIUS client secret (AES-256-CBC encrypted, base64 encoded)

created_at.description: Timestamp when the record was created

updated_at.description: Timestamp when the record was last updated

RadiusVendor.description: RADIUS vendor entity representing a network equipment vendor

version.description: Version or additional information about the vendor

x-readme.description: This API follows RESTful principles and returns responses in a consistent JSON format. All endpoints support the x-request-id header for request tracing. The API uses UUID v4 for all resource identifiers. Input sanitization and XSS protection are automatically applied to all string inputs.
notes: All timestamps are in UTC and follow ISO 8601 format
UUID format validation is enforced on all identifier fields
Numeric coordinates (latitude/longitude) are validated within valid ranges
All endpoints include optional request_id in responses for debugging
Error responses include detailed validation messages in the errors array
